breaking.title: France officially begins preparations for the 2030 Winter Olympics after flag handover
European streaming records surge following Milano-Cortina 2026 closing ceremony
Major winter storm continues to disrupt parts of North America

main.title: France Takes Olympic Flag, Launching Road to 2030 Winter Games
main.summary: France has officially received the Olympic flag following the conclusion of the Milano-Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics. Celebrations marked the symbolic transition as preparations intensify for the 2030 Winter Games in the French Alps, with infrastructure planning and committee restructuring already underway.

secondary.title: Milano-Cortina 2026 Closes With Cultural Celebration
secondary.summary: The Winter Games concluded with a vibrant closing ceremony celebrating athletes, international unity and European heritage.

secondary.title: Olympic Committee Restructuring Begins in France
secondary.summary: Organizational changes and leadership adjustments are shaping early preparations for the 2030 Winter Olympics.

secondary.title: Global Markets React to Post-Olympic Economic Forecasts
secondary.summary: European markets show cautious optimism as analysts review the economic impact of the Winter Games.

updates: Streaming viewership hits record highs across Europe
Winter storm alerts remain active in North America
Infrastructure discussions begin for French Alps venues
Milano-Cortina 2026 praised for record digital engagement
